generated.title: GeneratedHeatCapacity
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'HeatCapacity'

description*.en: "Heat Capacity" (usually denoted by a capital $C$, often with subscripts), or thermal capacity, is the measurable physical quantity that characterizes the amount of heat required to change a substance's temperature by a given amount. In the International System of Units (SI), heat capacity is expressed in units of joule(s) (J) per kelvin (K).

title: HeatCapacity
description: "Heat Capacity" (usually denoted by a capital $C$, often with subscripts), or thermal capacity, is the measurable physical quantity that characterizes the amount of heat required to change a substance's temperature by a given amount. In the International System of Units (SI), heat capacity is expressed in units of joule(s) (J) per kelvin (K).
